title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,956.95 USD/T on December 24, 2025, up 0.32% from the previous day, with a 5.16% increase over the past month and 15.51% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures reached $2,950 per tonne in December, near three-year highs amid low supply concerns. China prioritizes preventing overcapacity to curb deflationary pressures.

title: Aluminum Rises to 3½-Year Highs
summary: Aluminum futures climbed toward $2,970 per tonne, the highest since May 2022, following South32's announcement to place its Mozal smelter under care and maintenance by March 2026 due to power issues. Supply tightens with disruptions at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter and declining Japanese inventories. Prices have risen nearly 17% this year, supported by China's output cap.

title: Copper, Aluminium Prices Gain on Supply Concerns Amid Mixed U.S. Data
summary: Aluminum prices rose with Shanghai gaining 0.55% to 21,915 yuan per ton and London benchmark up 0.26% to $2,884 a ton, driven by South32's Mozal smelter shutdown. Analysts expect low global inventories and further upside next year. This occurs amid broader metal market movements and supply concerns.

title: Novelis Wins German Ecodesign Award for Recycled Aluminium Automotive Sheet
summary: Novelis received the German Ecodesign Award for a production-ready aluminium alloy made using 100% recycled end-of-life automotive scrap, demonstrating technically and economically feasible car-to-car aluminium recycling and advancing its Novelis 3x30 circularity strategy. The company says the innovation can significantly reduce CO₂ emissions compared with primary aluminium by leveraging closed-loop recycling and higher shares of end-of-life material in automotive alloys.

title: Market trends, policy signals and innovation together suggest a recalibration within the global aluminium downstream industry
summary: ALCircle's industry roundup highlights leadership, policy and innovation shaping the aluminium downstream sector ahead of 2026, and reports on several technology developments including Nagoya University researchers' new aluminium alloys that retain strength at high temperatures and are highly recyclable and suitable for metal 3D printing. The piece frames these innovations alongside policy tools such as CBAM and market signals affecting downstream competitiveness and decarbonisation.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
summary: The Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers selected aluminium-air long-duration generation technology (from Phinergy) for a funded project to scale clean backup energy systems to MW-level and deploy them in live data centers, aiming to replace diesel generators and accelerate net-zero operations. The announcement positions aluminium-air systems as a promising clean backup energy option for sustainable digital infrastructure.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever pilot 'carbon-free' smelting technology in personal and home care packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever are piloting the Elysis carbon-free smelting technology to produce aluminium for personal and home care packaging, advancing efforts to decarbonise primary aluminium production by eliminating direct carbon emissions from the smelting process. The pilot represents collaboration between major producers and end-users to test low-carbon supply chain solutions for packaging.

title: Steel industry urges FBR to seek advance tax guarantees on duty-free Chinese imports via Sost
summary: Pakistan's steel producers have urged the Federal Board of Revenue to require advance tax guarantees from importers of duty-free Chinese steel products via the Sost Dry Port to prevent diversion to taxable areas. The industry highlights Pakistan's surplus steel production capacity and opposes tax exemptions on finished steel goods. They suggest limiting exemptions to raw materials or scrap to protect local production.

title: Business sentiment for January pessimistic over slump in construction, steel sectors: Poll
summary: South Korea's business sentiment index for January signals pessimism, particularly in the steel and construction sectors, with the steel sector reading at 85.2 below the 100 benchmark. The Federation of Korean Industries attributes the slump to weak performance dragging down related industries like metal processing. Experts call for government support in restructuring steel and reducing financial burdens on raw materials.

title: Technological Innovation Leads the Global Steel Industry into a Low-Carbon Era
summary: The 2025 global steel industry is driven by technological innovations promoting low-carbon, intelligent, and high-end development. Key advancements include Ansteel’s world-first green electricity and green hydrogen fluidized bed hydrogen metallurgy pilot line, achieving 95% metallization with near-zero carbon emissions, and Shougang’s selection as a global Lighthouse Factory. These technologies address high emissions and energy consumption, fostering green transformation and high-quality industry growth.

title: Reflecting on 2025: Circularity, Sustainability and Transformation for Steel Manufacturing
summary: As 2025 ends, New Zealand's steel manufacturing sector highlights progress in circularity and sustainability, led by the announcement of an Electric Arc Furnace (EAF) at New Zealand Steel for lower-carbon production from recycled scrap. Initiatives include digital material passports for lifecycle traceability to enhance reuse and recycling, alongside the development of a national hub for advanced manufacturing and circular innovation in a 6-star greenstar building. These efforts demonstrate steel's role in sustainable construction with over 50% carbon emission reductions through design and material choices.

title: Copper surges to record near $13,000 in London after a 7% jump
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange surged nearly 7% to an all-time high near $13,000 per tonne after reopening following a two-day hiatus. The metal hit as high as $12,960 per tonne, driven by expectations of massive flows to the US leaving global shortages. Aluminium and zinc also rose by 0.6% and 0.9% respectively.

title: Copper Price Rally Nears All-Time High of $12,000 a Ton in 2025
summary: Copper prices edged towards $12,000 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, up 0.4% amid supply setbacks and tariff-related trade issues fueling a rally. The metal is on track for its largest annual gain since 2009, with prices up 37% this year due to US-bound flows draining global inventories. Analysts note rising prices driven by sentiment despite soft demand.

title: Copper Prices, Charts, Analysis & Forecast | SMM Metals Market
summary: Copper prices have surged strongly since mid-September 2025, repeatedly hitting record highs, with SHFE.CU2602 at CNY/mt 101,380. High-grade copper traded around USD 12,316.7 per mt as of Dec 26. Rising prices are driving up motor costs and supply chain pressures.

title: Copper prices hit record as investors bet on tighter times coming ...
summary: Copper prices hit records in Shanghai and rallied in New York, with Shanghai futures nearing 100,000 yuan per tonne and Comex up 5.6% to $5.8075 a pound. Investors anticipate tighter global supplies next year amid a weaker US dollar and energy transition demand. The rally caps a 42% yearly gain for copper.

title: Copper on fire: Why prices are at record highs and what's next
summary: Copper prices reached record highs in late 2025, driven by US Federal Reserve easing, trade policy arbitrage, supply disruptions, and demand from electrification and AI. A persistent deficit is expected, with India's strong domestic demand contributing to record local prices. The surge reflects robust global industrial trends.

title: DRC Suspends Handmade Copper Business, SHFE Copper Rose Sharply Last Friday [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: The Democratic Republic of Congo ordered a suspension of all manual copper and cobalt processing operations pending proof of legal and traceable ore sources, a move likely to disrupt local small- and medium-sized processors and tighten supply chains. Shanghai Futures Exchange (SHFE) copper prices rose sharply, with trading volumes increasing and spot premiums weakening ahead of the New Year holiday.[1]

title: Copper hits US$12,000 for first time as tariff trade upends market
summary: Copper rose above US$12,000 a tonne amid mine outages, trade dislocations and falling inventories, driving one of the largest annual gains since 2009 and prompting warnings of a potential major supply deficit next year. Several large projects suffered setbacks (including Kamoa-Kakula and Codelco operations), and banks warn of tightening markets that could push prices higher.[2]

title: Trigon exits battle via Kombat Mine sale
summary: Trigon Resources sold the Kombat copper mine as part of exiting a long-running dispute, in a market environment where copper futures have climbed to multi-month highs driven by supply concerns and strong demand. The article notes recent copper futures around US$5.48–5.50 per pound and situates the transaction amid broader market strength.[3]

title: Copper Hits Five-Month Peak; Prices Rise on Tight Supply and Strong Demand
summary: Copper futures hit five-month highs (around $5.7 per pound) as tight supply, robust US economic activity and structural demand from EVs, renewables and AI infrastructure underpinned prices; the page also reports recent national production figures for Chile and Peru. The report highlights inventory pressures and continued price appreciation through late December.[4]

title: Copper prices hit record as investors bet on tighter times coming
summary: Shanghai and New York copper prices surged to record or near-record levels as investors priced in tighter global supplies next year, aided by a weaker US dollar and large annual gains; the piece links price strength to trade dislocations and the energy transition boosting long-term demand. The article reports SHFE copper trading near 100,000 yuan/tonne and Comex copper reaching intraday highs above $5.80/lb.[5]

title: Copper on fire: Why prices are at record highs and what's next
summary: An analysis of record-high copper prices attributes the rally to a combination of Federal Reserve easing expectations, trade policy arbitrage, major supply disruptions and rising demand from electrification and AI. The piece discusses outlooks from major banks and the potential for persistent deficits supporting further price gains.[6]

title: Can the sizzling rally in ASX 200 copper stocks boost BHP shares in 2026?
summary: The article examines how the rally in copper is benefiting ASX-listed miners and notes BHP's record FY25 copper production of 2,017 kt, driven by stronger performances across operated assets and projects that could deliver ~2 Mtpa of attributable copper production during the 2030s. It contextualizes producer-level capacity increases amid the broader market rally.[7]

title: Nickel Futures Rebound as Indonesia Signals Output Cuts for 2026
summary: Nickel futures rose to around $15,200 per tonne, the highest in nearly two months, after Indonesia signalled a large reduction in planned nickel output for 2026 which could tighten supply and support prices; analysts noted Indonesia accounts for a large share of the global surplus and that proposed policy changes to ore pricing and royalties may further restrict exports and byproduct flows.

title: On December 29, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: Shanghai Metals Market reported the SMM #1 refined nickel price range and an average price for December 29, 2025, showing an intraday rise (average price 131,700 yuan/mt, up 2,000 yuan/mt from the prior period), reflecting local refined-nickel market moves amid supply tightness in Indonesia and year-end dynamics.

title: SMM Nickel Flash — December 29: Indonesia’s ore market remains tight as 2025 closes
summary: A rapid market note summarised December 29 developments, stating Indonesia's nickel ore market remains structurally tight and describing downward price pressure from weak demand in some segments while noting policy and supply shifts that could alter near-term balances.

title: Viewpoint: Indonesia's MHP surge to hit nickel prices
summary: Argus analysts argued that nickel prices will likely stay depressed in the low-$15,000s per tonne in 2026 as supply expansion outpaces demand, with Indonesia’s mixed high-phosphate (MHP) output dynamics and a cooling EV demand growth cited as key factors weighing on prices despite intermittent tightness.

title: Nickel inches down ahead of Fed's decision
summary: A market brief reported nickel edging lower amid a firmer US dollar and a bearish research outlook from a major US bank projecting lower metal prices into 2026, noting macro drivers (FX and rate expectations) and analyst forecasts that contributed to near-term softening in nickel prices.
